Reviews.Title: “Cool and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: tentimestwenty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for clean freaks. It is for people who like character. The many different theme rooms are worth it alone, but I generally found the service and price to be very good. Where else can you stay in downtown Vancouver for under $100 a night? The rooms were quiet and the hotel was mostly empty so I found it very relaxing, more like an apartment away from home.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP and CHIC for the non-beige set”
Reviews.Author: walterr
Reviews.Content: i understand that this hotel is not for everyone....they even say so on dominion website. but if you want an inexpensive place to stay and somewhere different from holiday inn...this might be the place for you. Great concept.....have local artist decorate each of the room so noo two are alike. I stayed two nights and actually switched rooms to have different experience... i loved the butterfly room, perhaps 1000 butterflys on the ceiling of a red room. it was very cozy. the towels are n othing to write home about but its fine for a budget hotel....the neighborhood is filled with great bakeries and amazing clothing and furniture stores....i like the contrast between the high end and the low end like this hotel. 2 blocks from the skytrain station so i didnt even take a cab to my meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: Brandoak
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for just 2 days, and having checked out of my first night hotel (another story!) chose the Dominion while vwalking around Gastown - it looked quite attractive, and the lobby seemed fine. The room was really quite grotty. I was booked on an early morning Greyhound to Banff next day, so went to bed at about 11pm. By 2am I knew I would not get any sleep here - the room was vibrating from the bar/disco below. So I left at 2.30am and managed to get a middle of night Greyhound - and had a good sleep on the bus! If you do come here - check out where your room is in relation to night noise.

Reviews.Title: “Seasoned travlers say 'gross'”
Reviews.Author: laysh
Reviews.Content: OK, I never write these things, but this place was such a dump I feel the need to steer folks clear of it. First of all, my girlfriend and I are seasoned travelers who've backpacked thru Europe and done the litany of youth hostels and budget hotels. We are both architects, and are very open minded to non-conventional accomodations. So, we found the Dominion Hotel in the Lonely Planet guide and looked it up on the web. They have a really really nice looking website that completely sucked us in. Beware! Seriously, it makes the place look like a friendly, savvy, "artistic" place. It seemed like it would be right up our alley. We booked a month in advance, and called the night before to confirm. The girl working the desk didn't speak English very well and was unable to use the computer to find our reservation. She assured us it was there, but wasn't able to pull it up. We arrived in Vancouver the next day, and to our dismay, found that you couldn't reach the hotel by car because all of the blocks around the hotel were blocked off for a bike race. Now, I understand that this bike race is once a year and there is nothing the hotel can do about it, but they should have informed us the night before when we called that the garage they recommended parking in was not going to be accessible. So, after driving around the worst part of Vancouver for a while, we found a sketchy garage sandwiched between a salvation army soup kitchen and a women's drop-in center. The garage had no attendant and was of the self-service pre-pay style. The place stunk of urine and we decided there was no way in hell we were leaving the rental car in there. So, we called the hotel to ask for a suggestion. We got the same girl from the night before, and spent 35 mintues (literally) on the phone with her trying to determine where we should park. Now, I can't fault her language skills (as I've been all over Europe without speaking their languages), but a basic skill a person needs to work the front desk of a hotel that has no parking is the ability to tell the guests where to go to park! Anyway, I was about to cancel the reservation right there, but my girlfriend talked me down and we drove around until we found a garage in a little less seemly environment. Now it was time to run the gauntlet. We live in San Francisco, and I've done work all over the worst parts of Oakland, but the three block walk between the parking garage and the "hotel" were some of the worst I've seen. TONS of drug addicts on the sidewalks and in the alleys and homeless people on every corner. Again, this isn't the hotel's fault, and it is a neighborhood in transition (ie, is currently undergoing gentrification), but damn, it was scary at midday on a weekday! And then we've got those dumb rollerbag carry-on things trailing behind us screaming "we're tourists". Seriously, we lived in San Francisco's tenderloin for 3 years and I've never felt that much of a target. Finally we arrive at the hotel. The girl at the front desk was very friendly, but it became immediatley apparent that she was ill equipped and untrained for her job. She was unable to find our reservation at all in the computer, but said "oh, it doesn't matter, there are plenty of rooms". Man, that just burns me up. What's the point of making a reservations if your employees can't enter them or find them?! We can clearly see two other men in the back office that seem to be of managerial status, but they never come out or attempt to help in any way. So, my girlfriend (always cool and collected) squares away the room and we get our keys. There is no elevator, so we lug our bags up the stairs. Half way up the staircase it becomes immediatley apparant that this is not fully a hotel. It's more like an SRO (single room occupany) that is being transitioned into a hotel. Some of the rooms have numbers on the doors and some don't. We passed two middle aged residents in the hallway smoking joints. Being from San Francisco, this isn't alarming to us in any way, but man, what a first impression! After navigating the signless hallway, we located our room and opened the door (which has some hearts painted on the door) to find something a bit less than expected. Instead of "artsy", we found a pretty plain room in sore need of renovation. The bedroom was painted flat black, there was a beat up armchair (complete with mystery stains), a rickety table and a nasty bed with stained mattress. The sheets had cigarette burn holes in them, the comforter was covered in dark stains, the carpet was at least 15 years old, the toilet wouldn't flush and there was nothing vaguely artistic except for some red christmas lights strung in the middle of the ceiling. I mean seriously, "art hotel"? My dorm room in college was cleaner and more artistic! Needless to say, we returned to the counter and checked out immediately. I can appreciate the idea of the Dominion Hotel, and I hope that one day they do manage to convert the building to a wonderful art hotel. The exterior of the building is great, but right now the interior is an ugly building full of druggies (that they're most likely trying to evict) in a dodgey part of town. Avoid this one! ps-> I've noticed from reading other posts for this hotel that the management is fond of refuting the negative posts. I read one that said that they've "recently renovated" and that all of the linens "are new and clean". This is certainly a lie as our room was neither renovated nor had clean linens. I mean really, I've stayed in youth hostels in church basements that had 100 year old linens that were cleaner and better cared for than these!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Dominion is not a hotel for the boring.. we stayed in the hearts room, which is painted a deep red, with christmas lights strung over the bed, and 3-d glasses are provided. when you put the glasses on.. it looks like hearts are falling on your head. It was VERY clean, which is my only real requirement with a hotel. The bar was closed the night we stayed, so I cant comment on the noise.. however the only noise we heard came from a drunk man wandering down the street screaming at the top of his lungs; which is not exactly something the management can control. The only problems that slightly bothered me was the slanting floors.. only because I am currently in school to become an architect and from the 2 inch gap between our door to the hallway and the floor.. and the slant of our floor in general.. the building showed its age. The other thing was our room bordered the room of a long term tenant who left her door wide open to the hallway, smoked, and had her TV on very loud.. she was also cooking something very foul smelling.. again, not really the managements fault except that we asked for a non-smoking room, only to be put next door to a smoker. I know that had we asked to me moved they would have obliged! No elevator, but not a big deal if you dont have many bags. The employees were wonderfully helpful, they gave us great directions to local bars, eateries, and to the concert hall we were headed to, and they were there for us all night. They asked us each time we entered and each time we exited the building if there was anything else we needed. Its not perfect, but its fun, and it truly is unique. If you are stuck up and scared to try something new... go for the plain old "holiday inn"... but if you are looking for something fun and exotic.. it truly is a fun stay (one night was enough for me, I WOULD stay again, but for one night at a time.)

Reviews.Title: “This place is a pit!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's at the edge of a drug-ridden, blighted area. Nobody who knows Gastown advises walking anywhere east of Abbott St. - day or night. The hotel's stairway and hallway carpeting is stained and worn. There's no elevator. The room had ancient debris in the corners and around the radiator pipe (linens were clean) Hard to tell what had been "remodeled", other than carpeting torn up from the floor with the glue underneath left for effect (there was a newer rug on top of this). The room was too hot and the radiator couldn't be turned off. You may be a non-smoker, but there are smoking residents in one whole end of the hotel. My non-smoking room (with large gap at bottom of the door) smelled like burned popcorn and distant cigarette and pot smoke. Unless you can sleep through absolutely anything, don't expect to get to sleep before 2 am - provided earplugs or no. They didn't even have live music or more than a few customers, but the disco music in the bar two stories down came through loud and clear. The up-for-debate "art" in the rooms was painted and dripped down directly on the walls and doorways. The floor slanted so much that there was no problem keeping the bathroom door shut; it wouldn't stay open. They'll tell you that it only costs $7 for covered overnight parking. What they don't say is that this is only after 6 pm and that after 8 am the parking costs $1 per 1/2 hour. On a positive note, the staff was very helpful and nice. - I hightailed it out of there and stayed the rest of the time in a nice clean, older motel just out of downtown for only $5 more a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: snacks
Reviews.Content: We had made reservations at the DomionHotel during our Canada Trip inMay 2005. On arrival the outside of the hotel looked nice however the inside was very disappointing. We walked into a very drab reception area which was in dire need of redecoration and cleaning. This applied to the other areas of the hotel in particular the stairways which pass by communal toilets and rooms for long staying guests. The room although clean was not quite what we expected, decorated only by some plum paint and some red fairy lights. We also realised that there was a bar directly below us. I have to say we were expecting a little more. It was such a shame as it had the potential to be much much better. We checked out without staying the night and stayed at the Best Western which is a stones throw from the beach, a short walk from Stanley Park and is close to an extremely nice italian resturant "Romanos Pizza Bar and Grill" set in an old manor house. Do not be put off by the name .

Reviews.Title: “Guest beware...”
Reviews.Author: nickiunicorn
Reviews.Content: My mother and I visited Vancouver for the first time July 21st - 23rd. We had reservations at the Dominion Hotel in Downtown Vancouver based on the reviews from this and other sites. But we never made it to the hotel. First, we called the hotel for direction from the ferry. The front desk staff could not give us clear directions on how to get to the hotel or where we should park especially considering a major event was happening near the hotel. So, we had to stop at an auto body shop and ask for directions. When we told them where we were going that when we got our first hint of what you have to go through to get to the hotel. Once we arrived at the section of town where the hotels is located (Gastown) you have to pass the area where most of Vancouver's homeless and drug addicts’ hangout. With every major city, you expect there to be the homeless and drug addicts but not so in your face. We could not get to the hotel because it was blocked off due to the Vancouver cycling tournament. And we did not have clear directions on how to get to the hotel around the block and where to park. So, we were forced back by the bad section which is only two blocks away. As I said, we never made it to the hotel instead we were to get a room at the Best Western Downtown on Drake Street. Don't stay in the area known as Gastown but go and visit it. Spend the extra $20 to $30 dollars and stay somewhere else. Vancouver is an expensive city and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Dominion Hotel- fun and affordable”
Reviews.Author: redbeard
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 2 sisters over July 4th weekend. Except for some minor maintenance issues, this hotel is prefectly nice. The Art Concept rooms were fun(see photos)- the rooms were small but comfortable- and the staff were all as nice as could be. I wasn't expecting the Ritz, but my room for the weekend ended up costing about the same as lunch for 2 there! The location was perfect for downtown sightseeing - and 2 blocks from the Skytrain/seabus terminal. I will be returning again, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Run As Fast As You Can”
Reviews.Author: nnatasha44
Reviews.Content: i was a long time guest there, not only is there mices and bed bugs in the suites.the suite itself with bedding being in terrible condition with stains and cigerette holes.

Reviews.Title: “Double check your reservation”
Reviews.Author: PCVBG
Reviews.Content: Actually never got to stay in the hotel, because they had overbooked and we got bumped. Had called a few days prior for a reservation, but upon check-in, the clerk informed us they were full. Yes, they said, they had our reservation, but apparently the "new guy" doesn't yet have the hang of the reservation system. Good hotels are supposed to put you up in another place, at their expense, when this happens. But not the Dominion, all they could offer was an apology and a wish of "good luck finding some place else." Being that it was Saturday afternoon on an American holiday weekend, this proved to be quite a hassle and challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Cliche I Know, however, IF IT SEEMS TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It sounded great, and we decided to stay here because of the good reviews we read here. The pictures looked funky and the idea of rooms designed by local artists and that it was newly renovated sealed the deal. Besides you can't go wrong with the price right?!? After being awake until 330 am. because of the LOUD music and general rowdiness from the bar downstairs, noises were also heard coming from inside our room. And when I stay at a hotel in Vancouver, I do NOT expect nor desire to find a large rodent scurrying around in the darkness!!! Yes, a rodent, which quickly ran behind the water heater when I turned on the light. We are checking out and never staying here again. Besides the rooms were a disappointment, tiny tiny tiny, and the pictures on the web hugely exaggerate the desirability of.... Not Recommended, unless you really need a cheap place and do not plan on sleeping in the room at night anyways.
